intro: Helianthella californica var. shastensis, commonly known as Shasta helianthella, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its yellow, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes. It has hairy stems and leaves, and its small, white to yellow flowers bloom in early spring. This variety is distinguished by its geographic distribution and specific morphological traits compared to other varieties of Helianthella californica.
